doc.title: 24 Frames Per Day
doc.plot: 24 FRAMES PER DAY was conceived by combining 24 photographs taken each day over a period of 9 months, combined with a conversation with a taxicab driver while returning from the airport. The film raises important questions around immigration, cultural stereotypes, and the meaning of 'home' from a transnational perspective.
